#talentpool #skyhightower #lbfalumni #growth', "When I interviewed someone and their laptop...Some years ago, I was building my team at the company I was working at. The profiles of number of candidates were brought to my attention and then the most promising ones were invited to an in-person interview.I was looking for someone who was an independent contributor and could take initiative to resolve problems and work collaboratively with other team members.In one particular interview I held, the candidate sat in front of me across the meeting table, opened his laptop at the start, without mentioning to me what he was intending to do with the laptop.At one point, after I posed a role related question, the candidate tapped away at his laptop to get some information.I recall that I was not particularly impressed. I had not seen someone respond to interview questions using a computer in person in the moment! I waited with patience for a little time as the response was promised.This occurred more than once during the interview.The interview proceeded to the skills I was looking for and to see if the candidate was a good fit within the team. All I recall was how the processes at the company he worked at were vastly superior to the ones we had in place at that point in time. Very little was said about what the candidate could propose as solutions as a way forward.I had been patient and had given the candidate the chance to show something that first impressions did not.I had made up my mind that the candidate was unsuitable for my team.My observation of the candidate in that interview relates more to their self awareness.\xa0These are three questions for consideration:üëâHow self aware were they of their situation?üëâHow self aware were they in the way they presenting themselves?üëâHow could this person improve their self awareness?ü§îWhat do you think of this scenario?ü§îWhen have you become aware of self awareness in others?‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äîüí° I am Jung, I coach ambitious individuals and purpose-driven businesses to tackle their key challenges, regain control and find purpose (through my personal mastery methodology). ü§î\xa0If you'd like to know more or explore how I could support you, please reach out to me for a strategy call where we can look at what is missing for you in order to achieve what you want and find meaning in what you do. This is a 60 minute process where we explore together what you would like to achieve and how coaching can help. #selfawareness #leadershipcoaching #personalmastery #jungpersonalmastery", 'https://lnkd.in/guxNaeUc#Smart', 'https://lnkd.in/g-StFrjNSome lovely vintage inspiration ‚ú®#inspiration #industrialdesign', None, None, None, None]

name: –†—É—Å–ª–∞–Ω –ì—É—Å–µ–π–Ω–æ–≤
reactions: ['#humor #it', '–Ø #–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—é. –ó–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ –ª—é–¥–µ–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö —ç—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∑–∞–∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å?', "This story is about my path to IT.I had some time recently to think about how I ended up where I am (I mean in IT). And it seemed to me that my story was fairly standard as far as my progress turned out to be quite logical and systematic. Just think about it.üìå Comfort environmentEveryone in my family was an engineer. This fact has determined my further way in many respects. First, a computer is a must in the engineering family. Secondly, my father was okay with my interest in video games and even supported it. He installed games and programs, let me play, and waited for my hobby to grow into something bigger. Dad was right.At the age of six, I was pretty sure about creating my own game. I even made my first design document, where I wrote lore, made sketches of characters, weapons and so on. In my mind it looked like a massive RPG, much cooler than Morrowind. But the realities were harsh, because no one I knew had any idea how to do something like that.üìå Lack of knowledge and first victoryI realized that my knowledge was poor, so I searched through the Internet for information. I found out that websites are based on HTML and decided to collect all the clich√©s of a newbie programmer (started coding websites). But soon I got bored, as I realized that it wasn't going to get me any closer to my own game.\xa0Luckily, at some point (I was about 9 years old) I got a program called Game Maker. After a month of total confusion, I started making my first game (a simple maze where the hero must get to the finish without hitting the walls). I was carried away by the process, and all the other projects followed (so far without code).üìå Soul searching and the answerWhen I grew old enough to master code, it was time to move on to something more serious. I chose Unity. When I created a few prototypes, I started feeling like I was going to be a programmer. So, I spent the next five years participating in projects for free to improve my skills. But then I realized that I didn't want to spend my time just on code. I enjoy programming, but not 100% of the time (5% at most).Then I thought about something else, so I took up sound design. There I obtained valuable experience in managing teams, translating and dubbing games. I realized that I liked project work. So, as a team leader, I officially got into GameDev, and then into IT (also involved in project management).At the moment, I suppose I am the best when I combine different roles: businessman, manager, and operations manager ( although my interest in GameDev is still with me).Afterword:Of course, my path in IT took more than one day and involved hundreds of books read and dozens of projects that brought no money. But I'm glad I chose it with all its nice (and not so nice) moments.Every path is different, of course, but I wonder if my story is similar to yours in some way at least.", '–ù–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω—é –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–æ–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞—é—â–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ ‚Äì –≠—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç –î–∞–Ω–Ω–∏–Ω–≥–∞-–ö—Ä—é–≥–µ—Ä–∞.–≠—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç –∑–≤—É—á–∏—Ç —Ç–∞–∫: ¬´–õ—é–¥–∏, –∏–º–µ—é—â–∏–µ –Ω–∏–∑–∫–∏–π —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –∫–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –¥–µ–ª–∞—é—Ç –æ—à–∏–±–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥—ã –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç –Ω–µ—É–¥–∞—á–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã –æ—Å–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏ –≤ —Å–∏–ª—É —Å–≤–æ–µ–≥–æ –Ω–∏–∑–∫–æ–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –∫–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏¬ª.–†–∞—Å—à–∏—Ñ—Ä—É–µ–º: –ù–µ–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à—ë–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –∫ —É–±–µ–∂–¥—ë–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ—Ç–µ, –∞ —Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ, –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏—é —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –∏ –≤ —Å–µ–±–µ, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∫ –æ—Å–æ–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–≤–æ–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–µ–≤–æ—Å—Ö–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –¢–∞–∫–∏–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–º —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç –î–∞–Ω–Ω–∏–Ω–≥–∞-–ö—Ä—é–≥–µ—Ä–∞ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Å–∏—Ö–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º –ø–∞—Ä–∞–¥–æ–∫—Å–æ–º, —Å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º –≤—Å–µ –º—ã —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∫–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—Å—è –≤ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏: –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–µ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –ª—é–¥–∏ —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—é—Ç —Å–µ–±—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏, –∞ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–µ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Å–∫–ª–æ–Ω–Ω—ã —Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —Å–µ–±–µ –∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö. –ß–µ–º –Ω–∏–∂–µ —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –∫–æ–º–ø–µ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ - name: Alexey Sergienko
reactions: ["Why is PR one of the crucial areas to pay attention to when launching a startup? Our CEO, Pavel, shares his experience. One pretty common mistake shared by startup founders is that they usually neglect the necessary media coverage of their project. They always pay more attention to the development of new features, searching for investments and daily management routine. What you have to understand is that spreading the word about your product will indirectly help you in all the other areas of your business.For example, a simple social media post about a new feature can quickly help to collect feedback from your target audience and suggest whether it's time to release a new update or there is still something to work on. A well-written article about the project in a respected magazine on its own can urge investors to contact you. A single CEO comment about the working environment and company‚Äôs priorities can help hunt the best staff. Such is the power of media. My advice is the following: hire a PR agency, develop a brand positioning strategy, and these investments will pay off in no time.Share your own stories and opinions in the comments. You can also ask our CEO any questions you like and we will answer the most interesting ones in our stories. Stay tuned! #PR #SaaS #Software #experience #strategy", 'Why use SaaS for engineers? It is the question we hear from almost everyone who finds out about FlowQe. After all, B2B platforms in such tricky areas should have the expertise in customer‚Äôs business. We are happy to share with you the story of our bumpy but fascinating ride, which we believe will flow for a very long time.The first chapter of our epic begins with projects for such renowned companies as ABB and Vimar. Thanks to them our team was able to build up the expertise and knowledge of the engineering business. It is during those sleepless nights we figured out how we can help companies automate their internal processes and rid them of project management troubles. Full with the acquired knowledge we decided to create FlowQe ‚Äì our own perfect service which combines the key functions for various business sectors interaction and at the same time ‚Äì reduces project implementation time to a possible minimum.What happened next?.. Don‚Äôt miss our next piece to find out!', '–° —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞—é, —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ ‚Äì Senior System Analyst –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ Okko! ', 'Hey! We‚Äôve developed a new amazing online platform. It‚Äôs called FlowQe and it will help you manage all your engineering business online. Better believe it. It has everything you need - supplier catalogs, cost sheet estimation, project statistics, client base and even labor cost control on construction sites. We provide our first customers with free access to the system and all the key functions. All we need from you is a little precious feedback you can give us about your user experience. You can get access by direct messaging us or by clicking on the link in our profile and submitting a request. Be efficient together with us!#engineering #software', 'I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Middle iOS developer at Trinity Agency!', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

2022!!!!----------------------------------At 50, I (once again!) decided to change everything in my life. I decided to go into the tech industry. I began to study the topic, ask people, and immediately grabbed a healthy portion of negativity:- Number 1. You\'re too old- Number 2. You have the wrong race- Number 3. It\'s too hard, you have to learn a lotIn 2021, I graduated from a coding bootcamp, launched my web development courses, and invested in an IT startup. But it seemed to me that this was not enough. To get into IT for real, you need to be a part of interesting projects.I started applying for developer vacancies.And here\'s the result - at 51, I got my first offer for the role of a software developer. It is not a fact that I will accept it, but the fact remains that I am in business.This journey took 12 months. It was not easy and there is indeed some truth in the negative.I want to appeal to the "youth" 40+, never give up. If I did it when I was 50+, then you can.For my part, I made a decision - from 2022 I will only accept 40+ for my courses.I have nothing against young people, but I want to support those who are being infringed upon.Those who want to study coding can apply in the form in the comments.Happy New Year and good luck in 2022 !!!!#newyear2022 #softwaredeveloper#motivation#recruitment', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

reactions: ['I am happy to announce that I am starting to work as a machine learning engineer at Yandex! My work will be focused on improving the search engine‚Äôs ranking algorithms for the e-commerce domain.', 'Let\'s stop using the word "talented".Oftentimes it assumes that some people have in-born talents while others are born without them at all.I am sure that everyone has the potential to be great at something even if they are neurodiverse or have challenges fitting into current society in some other way. The life and the career of autistic Temple Grandin is a wonderful example backing my point. She was thought to have little use on a livestock farm and in other careers in general but with some luck, support, and a ton of her own perseverance ended up revolutionizing how livestock farming works around the world!I strongly recommend watching a movie about her. It\'s a lot of fun too!Let\'s assume that everyone is talented and stop differentiating people using this word. Some people have just developed their talents while others haven\'t.The words I suggest instead of the word "talented" are "outstanding", "exceptional", "extraordinary", and "world-class". They don\'t assume in-born gifts and they live room for everyone to get to that amazing level.', '–ó–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Å—á–µ—Ç –≥—ç–ø–æ–≤ –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–º–∏ —É –°–¢–û Twitter (Parag Agrawal). –£ –Ω–µ–≥–æ –µ—â–µ –∏ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —É–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω—ã, 4 –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–∞ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ! –ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—â–∏–º –º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä–∞–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏–∫–∏: "–∞ —á–µ–≥–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç –ø—Ä—ã–≥–∞–µ—Ç —Å –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ" –∏ "–∞ —á–µ–≥–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç –¥–µ–ª–∞–ª —Ç–∞–∫ –¥–æ–ª–≥–æ –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–º–∏?"', "What companies pay the same salary globally? üí∏üåéüåçüåèThis means employees in the same position and the same seniority level get the same pay no matter if it's San Francisco, Kyiv, or Bangalore. They keep finishing as many tutorials and courses as they can thinking they are learning and improving their skills. But the actual teacher for them is not the instructor who is in that video course, rather it‚Äôs the practical hands-on experience. They need to get their hands dirty and apply ‚Äútry and fail‚Äù approach in learning things to get the real mastery of things. Here are few tips on how to avoid tutorial trap and become expert in any skill you want to learn:1) Try to solve any problem you have on your own first before looking at any tutorial. This way, you will learn how to find the solution by yourself.2) Only look at tutorials when you are stuck and you cannot find the solution by yourself. Do not look at tutorials as your first port of call.3) Try to understand the concepts behind the solution before just copy pasting the code. This way, you will have a better understanding of the problem and you will be able to apply the solution to other similar problems.4) Do not just follow along the tutorial, try to do things on your own and experiment with the code. This way, you will learn the concepts better and you will be able to apply them in other situations.5) Do not just finish the tutorial, try to apply what you have learned in other projects. This way, you will be able to consolidate your knowledge and you will be able to see how far you have come.So these are few tips on how to avoid tutorial trap and become expert in any skill you want to learn. name: Egor Kiryushchenko
reactions: ["Hey there! As it's my first post here, I figured I'd start with a perfect ice-breaker: sharing my recent experience with the Cultural Management certificate course at UniWien. I graduated from the program earlier this year and it was seriously awesome.Honestly, after finishing my bachelor's degree at Higher School of Economics, I wasn't sure I wanted to do another educational program ever again (if you know, you know). But working in the film industry made me realize that I missed the educational environment and the sense of community that comes with it. So when the opportunity to join the course at UniWien came up, I jumped on it.Let me tell you, getting to Vienna at that time and under those circumstances was a literal struggle! But every bit of effort I put into the course was worth it. I'm already applying what I learned to my work and seeing great results. I hope to share some of the exciting things I'm working on in Belgrade soon!One of the best things about the program was the people I met. It's not easy finding like-minded folks, but the Cultural Management certificate course brought together a diverse group of individuals who shared a passion for cultural management. The community we built was pretty special and took a special-special place in my heart.Rumor has it that UniWien is planning to launch a master's program for Cultural Management in the near future‚Ä¶ and I couldn't be more excited! If it's anything like the certificate course, I will be joining the moment it is open for application. And who knows where it could take me? ", '–í–æ—Ç –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å —Å —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤—â–∏–∫–∞–º–∏)', 'Last Saturday was a greate day for me, I opened 15th colloquium (conference) in IKI-SEA Bangkok University. This was my first offline event after COVID and I was pleased to participate as a key-note speaker. Thanks a lot Vincent Ribiere, Ph.D., D.Sc. the Managing Director and Co-Founder of the Institute for Knowledge and Innovation Southeast Asia (IKI-SEA) for this opportunity. I wish I'd been a better engineer, (I wasn't great at detail, or maths!) but at least I still have the thought processes which I use in everyday life all the time.  ", 'I\'m in the top 2% of users on StackOverflow. My content there has been viewed by over 1.7M people. And it\'s unlikely I\'ll ever write anything there again. Which may be a much bigger problem than it seems. Because it may be the canary in the mine of our collective knowledge. A canary that signals a change in the airflow of knowledge: from human-human via machine, to human-machine only. Don‚Äôt pass human, don‚Äôt collect 200 virtual internet points along the way.StackOverflow is *the* repository for programming Q&A. It has 100M users & saves man-years of time & wig-factories-worth of grey hair every single day. It is driven by people like me who ask questions that other developers answer. Or vice-versa. Over 10 years I\'ve asked 217 questions & answered 77. Those questions have been read by millions of developers & had tens of millions of views.But since GPT4 it looks less & less likely any of that will happen; at least for me. Which will be bad for StackOverflow. But if I\'m representative of other knowledge-workers then it presents a larger & more alarming problem for us as humans. What happens when we stop pooling our knowledge with each other & instead pour it straight into The Machine? Where will our libraries be? How can we avoid total dependency on The Machine? What content do we even feed the next version of The Machine to train on? When it comes time to train GPTx it risks drinking from a dry riverbed. Because programmers won\'t be asking many questions on StackOverflow. GPT4 will have answered them in private. So while GPT4 was trained on all of the questions asked before 2021 what will GPT6 train on? This raises a more profound question. If this pattern replicates elsewhere & the direction of our collective knowledge alters from outward to humanity to inward into the machine then we are dependent on it in a way that supercedes all of our prior machine-dependencies. Whether or not it "wants" to take over, the change in the nature of where information goes will mean that it takes over by default. Like a fast-growing Covid variant, AI will become the dominant source of knowledge simply by virtue of growth. If we take the example of StackOverflow, that pool of human knowledge that used to belong to us - may be reduced down to a mere weighting inside the transformer. Or, perhaps even more alarmingly, if we trust that the current GPT doesn\'t learn from its inputs, it may be lost altogether. Because if it doesn\'t remember what we talk about & we don\'t share it then where does the knowledge even go?We already have an irreversible dependency on machines to store our knowledge. But at least we control it. We can extract it, duplicate it, go & store it in a vault in the Arctic (as Github has done). So what happens next? I don\'t know, I only have questions. None of which you\'ll find on StackOverflow.(I write on AI from a technical and product perspective. If you find that interesting then please do follow me for more)', 'I will not be silent in the face of hypocrites and supporters of terror ‚Äî not outside of Israel and even more so at not at Tel Aviv #leetcode', 'Yesterday I got a bunch of great insights from the AustrianStartups workshop on cold email sales by Stephanie Biebel I want to share two things with you that made me see sales in a different light.1. The first rule of Fight Club is: never sell in the first email.Second rule of Fight Club is: never sell... well, you get the idea.If you want to mention your company\'s name, insert a link to your website, or boast about how amazing you are, you risk ruining the communication with that person forever.First, find out if the person has the pain point you want to solve. And the best call to action in this case would simply be a response of "YES" to your email. It is only after the first "YES" that you can introduce yourself or your company and then proceed to the long-awaited call.I believe this principle can work in any field, even if you\'re just looking for a new job.2. I realized that workshops with interaction and, most importantly, some visible results far surpass the typical lecture format. Yesterday\'s workshop by @Stephanie Biebel was exactly like that. I experienced a lot of emotions, challenged myself, and improved my cold email writing skills. If I have the opportunity to conduct workshops in the future, I will strive to make them lively and engaging, just like this one.A huge thank you to Stephanie and the entire AustrianStartups team!Claudio Rebernig Robin Kulha Ipek Hizar Arne Nostitz-Rieneck Nicole Bilek  #sales #ASmoments #communication', '‚úÖ –ó–∞–∫–æ–Ω—á–∏–ª Frontend JavaScript –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç "react pizza" –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Ñ–æ–ª–∏–æ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª –µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ github.üåê·¥Ö·¥á·¥ò ü·¥è è·¥á·¥Ö: https://lnkd.in/gtKfK3MCüìÑs·¥è·¥ú Ä·¥Ñ·¥á: https://lnkd.in/gzaz7hpD–ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å—É–µ—Ç –≤–∞—à–∞ –∞—Ä–≥—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ üÖµüÜÅüÖæüÖΩüÜÉüÖ¥üÖΩüÖ≥ üÜÅüÖ¥üÖ∞üÖ≤üÜÉ.üÖπüÜÇ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞ üòÉ üõ† –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ–º—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏: ¬∑ ReactJS 18 ¬∑ TypeScript ¬∑ Redux Toolkit (—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö / –ø–∏—Ü—Ü) ¬∑ React Router v6 (–Ω–∞–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ü–∏—è) ¬∑ Axios (–æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∞ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞ –Ω–∞ –±—ç–∫–µ–Ω–¥) ¬∑ React Hooks (—Ö—É–∫–∏) ¬∑ Prettier (—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–¥–∞) ¬∑ CSS-Modules / SCSS (—Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è) ¬∑ React Content Loader (—Å–∫–µ–ª–µ—Ç–æ–Ω) ¬∑ React Pagination (–ø–∞–≥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è) ¬∑ Lodash.Debounce ¬∑ Code Splitting, React Loadable, useWhyDidYouUpdate#frontend #javascript #react #flexbox\xa0#developer #opentowork\xa0', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

It does not reach the interviews yet, my CV is dismissed at the stages of viewing HR. I was not particularly upset by the refusals - I understand how difficult it is for Junior to find a job in Cyprus. I even started to study JS deeply, so as not to waste time‚Ä¶But today I was really upset!Most often, a standard unsubscription or nothing comes in response from the recruiter, rarely a detailed kind letter (thank them very much, my heart feels warmer).But today I read something like: ‚ÄúEverything is very good, but your experience is 8 months, and we are looking for a year.‚ÄùOH....@#&@... Are you serious? So formal?And how not to lie after that?!I don't want to embellish anything in my CV! But I'm afraid to forget everything by the time I find a job. posts: ["I'm excited to share that I've just updated my bot! It's my first attempt at using D-ID AI technology through my bot, and I'm thrilled with the results. Now you have the opportunity to bring your photos to life by giving it a try! This is just the beginning as my next step is to customize requests for creating animations.https://lnkd.in/ddtReF6X#Java #ai #d_id", 'Chatting with chat GPTI am excited to announce a new update for my Telegram bot, "SimpleAi_GPT_Bot" which has further improved the chatting mode. Additionally, I have added a statistical report that can be accessed using the "/statistics" command. I am thrilled to see that my bot is being used every day! Thank you all for using my app! I look forward to providing further updates in the future.https://lnkd.in/ddtReF6X#java #telegram #gpt', 'Hey there! I am excited to share my CV with all of you. I have put a lot of effort into crafting a document that showcases my skills and experience, and I am proud to share it with this community.If you have a moment to take a look, please let me know what you think! I am open to feedback and suggestions for improvement, and I am always looking for ways to grow and learn in my career.Thank you for your support and encouragement! I appreciate your likes and comments as I continue on my professional journey.#cv\xa0#share\xa0#community\xa0#experience\xa0#java\xa0#javadeveloper\xa0#softwaredeveloper\xa0#career', 'I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôve obtained a new certification: Java Advanced: functional, asynchronous and reactive programming from IBS Training Center! #java #training ', "     Excited to share that I started a new programming course last Monday to enhance my skills:https://lnkd.in/daQYjwyi    It has been an intensive but rewarding experience. Our team dedicates four hours each day to learning, and we've already covered topics such as Stream API, multithreading data processing, CompletableFuture, and NIO architecture. To solidify my understanding, I even created a Java project using functional programming that consolidates my new knowledge. The project is a web client that retrieves information about GitHub users, their repositories, and contributors:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dTBwsSzE     Looking forward to sharing more about my learning journey and applying these new skills to real-world projects! #java\xa0#experience\xa0#programming\xa0#learning\xa0#multithreading\xa0#functionalprogramming", "Great news! I have added a new feature to my Telegram bot that allows you to chat with ChatGPT 3.5, and ask any question to ChatGPT 3. If you're curious about AI, you now have the opportunity to compare different versions of the most popular AI platform! So why not give it a try? Simply follow the link to my bot and have some fun: https://lnkd.in/ddtReF6X\xa0#AI #Chatbot #Telegram #ChatGPT3", "If you want to try ChatGPT you can do it in my Telegram bot!It allows you to find answers about different topics and generate images using AI DALL-E 2 without registration or any fees: https://lnkd.in/ddtReF6XStory of creating:I heard about ChatGPT and decided that this was the time to start using it in my work.But, when I surfed the OpenAI site, I noticed that they have a free API with a Java library. Hmm... That's a good way to get deeply immersed in the topic! Then I thought that my son would be so much fun if I gave him an easy way to play with AI.After reading the documentation, I found that using the API I can access more features than those provided on the UI interface. For example:-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0using different AI models (some faster, some better with translation, and some smarter but slower);-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0changing some parts of my images;-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0creating new variations of my images;-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0generating new images by description;-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0creating a transcription of my audio message.So, two weeks later, we have a first release of my Telegram bot. It can answer your questions and draw pictures.PS. It does not save any information about users. If you want to see the code, visit the page of this project on GitHub https://lnkd.in/dFt8jQZ6#ChatGPT #DALLE #TelegramBot #AI #chatbot #machinelearning\xa0#translation #project #java ", 'My Telegram bot allows you to find answers and generate images using ChatGPT and DALL-E#ChatGPT #DALLE #TelegramBot #AI #chatbot #machinelearning\xa0#java #springboot ', "It's not an AD because I\xa0want to share my impressions about freeware software...I used some programs for saving notes and thought thatSublime text is best.\xa0Because it had a good style and functionality.However, when I started work at my current job Inotice that many of my colleagues use Notepad++. Photo 2: This week, getting ready to run training for a client‚Äôs employees in Asia timezones from the rather less slick surrounds of my desk at home in Amsterdam, with a webcam, a green screen and my co-presenter hundreds of miles away in Bristol.On that 2018 whirlwind tour I did my prep in Amsterdam, workshops in Hong Kong, a conference talk in Melbourne, more workshops in Sydney, and wrote up my findings while taking an extended route home via the Whitsundays and Bangkok. Eight flights, a whole lot of expense and carbon emissions and nowhere near enough sleep thanks to epic jetlag. Do I miss it? Hell yeah. I had some great opportunities to travel, to explore the world, to meet people. Was it an efficient way to work? If I‚Äôm honest, no. There is huge value in meeting face to face to build and sustain relationships. Effective remote working absolutely relies on trust and I know from working in globally dispersed companies that getting to know people makes a HUGE difference in your ability to work with them. But once you have that trust, you can use digital channels to sustain it and to work efficiently and effectively. Coming together now and again helps to establish it and rebuild it as it decays. As an external consultant I often have a core team I work with, and getting to know them and building strong trust relationships is critical to project success. I still travel to meet clients occasionally, as well as to industry conferences to keep in touch with my network. But as organisations - and the people within them - have established effective collaboration practices, the need to travel to do things like focus groups and training is greatly reduced. I‚Äôve certainly got better at planning and delivering these activities remotely, as have the tools to enable this. Running great remote meetings takes careful planning, but the quality of outputs is as good as anything I used to hop on a plane for. Is business travel coming back? No. Not the same extent. Is that a good thing? Probably.#remotework #workshops #businesstravel #futureofwork #newwaysofworking #remoteworking', 'We all have to start somewhere.', 'UÃ∏nÃ∏Ã∂identified flying objects detected at Kaspersky Drone Security Day.Identified by üëâ https://lnkd.in/eD_526Ph', 'This will be the most vulnerable thing I\'ll ever share.I\'ve gone back and forth whether to post this or not.We just had to layoff a few of our employees.I\'ve seen a lot of layoffs over the last few weeks on LinkedIn.Most of those are due to the economy, or whatever other reason.Ours?My fault.I made a decision in February and stuck with that decision for far too long. Now, I know my team will say that "we made that decision together", but I lead us into it.And because of those failings, I had to do today, the toughest thing I\'ve ever had to do.We\'ve always been a people first business. And we always will be.Days like today, I wish I was a business owner that was only money driven and didn\'t care about who he hurt along the way.But I\'m not.So, I just want people to see, that not every CEO out there is cold-hearted and doesn\'t care when he/she have to lay people off.I\'m sure there are hundreds and thousands of others like me. The ones you don\'t see talked about. Because they didn\'t lay off 50 or 500 or 5000 employees.They laid off 1 or 2 or 3.1 or 2 or 3 that would still be here if better decisions had been made.I know it isn\'t professional to tell my employees that I love them.But from the bottom of my heart, I hope they know how much I do.Every single one. Every single story. Every single thing that makes them smile and every single thing that makes them cry.Their families. Their friends. Their hobbies.I\'ve always hire people based on who they are as people. People with great hearts, and great souls.And I can\'t think of a lower moment than this.', 'UX –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–º —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–º - —ç—Ç–æ.. —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–æ—Ç. –ú–∏–Ω—É—Ç–∫–∞ —é–º–æ—Ä–∞)) –ö–æ–º—É –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ? #ux', 'Aaaaand‚Ä¶ another book translated from Spanish by me! This one is Endometriosis by Dr. Francisco Carmona Herrera, a great book for patients. Another step towards less stigma around female body and diseases! Right now, starting to translate another book in my free time; my main job is PM at Syneos Health and I love it!  #gynecology #endometriosis #books #translation #translator #syneoshealthlife #syneoshealth', 'LocLunch 23 Moscow was amazing again. Blown.', "if you know what's that , hi my friend :)", 'New company, new position, new challenges', 'üéâ Kaspersky turns 25! üéâCheck out the fun video below to see how Kaspersky, or rather our mascot Midori Kuma, defends users against the most widespread digital threats üëá#cybersecurity #hacking #security #business #software #security #malware #phishing #technology #cybersecurityawareness #datasecurity #dataprotection #ransomware #networksecurity #infosec #cybercrime #cyberattack #antivirus', 'IoT by Zabbix üí™Monitoreo y alerta de temperatura y humedad para datacenters con tecnolog√≠a Iot.\xa0Terminamos de montar con el equipo una soluci√≥n inicial de Iot monitoreada con Zabbix y Grafana hosteada en Azure ‚ö°Gracias! Matias Mazlat Romina Sosa Sebasti√°n Baron\xa0#CTL #NOC #HUB#tecnolog√≠a #azure #iot #cloud #mqttZabbix Cloud CTL Zabbix LatAm Zabbix Grafana LabsRa√∫l Mar√≠nhttps://zabbix.ctl.com.ar', "I'm sure everyone will have their own opinion on this but I feel there are a decent amount of situations when it should be acceptable to turn your camera off on zoom:-meetings with more than 5 people when you're not speaking-trainings-company wide meetings-if you're not feeling good-if you're calling in from outside your normal officeReally, the only situation where I think you should have it on is 1:1s but even then, as long as there is a tangible reason for not doing so, it shouldn't be a problem.#zoom #zoomfatigue #wellness", None]
posts: ['Mark Gurevich is #hiring. Know anyone who might be interested?', "Unfortunately, I find out this morning that my position at Meta may be affected in the latest downsizing round. Appreciated my time at #meta  and thankful for the people I met along the way.I have 8+ years of experience in technical recruiting, in Meta was responsible for hiring, to be honest I was flexing all the time so the list could be long, but some of the roles that I have cover included but not limited to the following. Without blood, tissue loses oxygen and dies. This can damage the heart\'s pumping power and lead to incurable heart failure.After heart failure, the only treatment option for some patients is a heart transplant, but organ donors are far fewer than those on the waiting list. Over 35,000 heart attacks occur in Canada every year, but only 200 heart transplants are performed.\xa0Although there are 2,000 heart transplants performed annually in the US, there are also 805,000 heart attacks.\xa0What are beating heart patches?Miniature plaster delivers stem cells designed to heal damaged heart tissue. Stem cells are being used by researchers to make tiny patches that will restore function to damaged cardiac tissue.\xa0How\xa0its work1)\xa0In this process, cells from the skin, blood, or urine of a patient are transformed into stem cells, which are then converted into heart cells. 2)\xa0Those cells are put into a special gel that encourages them to align and form patches of the heart muscle. The power of science for understanding and for technology. But personally, the joy of discovery is the big deal."What do you think is the most fun thing about science? Learn more about Thorne: https://lnkd.in/du2Uh7NT', '9 free websites to accelerate your learning:', 'If you are looking to learn a workflow language to write reproducible, scalable, portable, resource-efficient and legible #pipelines, check out my new #snakemake course at https://lnkd.in/esSWC7Uq !#datascience #bioinformatics #pipeline', "I won the Yandex Cup 2022 ML Audio Content competition!The task was given the song embeddings to predict it's author.The dataset consisted of 150k samples, total of 20k classes and the task was to optimize nDCG metric, - this metric is used to evaluate search engines.The model I trained not only allows to separate songs from authors with the same name, but also it has the ability to find similarities between songs, - it can help to build better recommendation system.In the end, the solution consists of shallow transformer encoder model trained with ArcFace head, and also due to certain dataset properties query expansion and reranking were an important factors to get the first place.Thanks goes to #yandex for ogranizing this competition, hope they'll host more competitions in the future!competition site: https://yandex.com/cup/ml/#yandex", "Dear everyone\xa0Don't switch to English when foreigners speak to you in your language.A lot of people who live abroad face a very particular challenge when learning the local language.\xa0They rarely get to practice.\xa0And without practice, they cannot become fluent.Daily life's small interactions make up 70% of mastering a new language. Please don't take that real-world practice away from them!If they want you to switch to English, they will let you know. English is the lingua franca everywhere, and people are pretty polite.\xa0So the moment you try to practice the language with a native speaker, they will often switch to English within 0,00001 seconds. To make it easy for you. But to learn a new language, you don't need easy.You need to go through a miserable rocky road of obstacles to come out fluent on the other side. So, dear everyone. Don't switch to English.\xa0Help internationals practice language everywhere.They will love you for it.\xa0üß°Nichlas WalstedSwap Language", 'When I just started Insilico Medicine, we were publishing research papers like crazy to explain what we do. There were no research or treatments on it in the world, and no one working on one anywhere in the world (we checked). My wife Geri, a pediatrician, and I refused to accept that as Lucy's life story so we started a non-profit charity Moonshots for Unicorns to rapidly develop treatments and cures for these disorders. For months, we worked and worked, day and night, and were lucky to convince some of the best scientists in the world including Kathrin Meyer and Ethan Perlstein to work on PGAP3, and now, 6 months later, a gene therapy FDA trial is within grasp, there are repurposed medicines being given to patients based on the mechanism of disease discovered....and 3 hours ago...Apple News ran the story of our daughter Lucy and our non-profit on every iPhone in the country! https://lnkd.in/gWbD6ry4 Even as physicians trained at UCSF, Harvard, and Stanford, outside of a few friends and family...I don't think anyone really thought we could make this happen. We're not there yet. Far from it. But, 6 months ago...no one had heard of PGAP3 and no one was working on it. Tonight, anyone with an iphone could read a detailed story on the disorder and the truly amazing scientific work that's being done today, and there is real reason to believe a cure is possible. This is momentum. This is a miracle in the making! (This is just the first of many pages of my email over the past few hours...)#miracles #research #nonprofit #genetherapy #fda #iphone #applenews #lifechanging #cure #raredisease ‚Äî‚Äî11/7 update - wow! I can‚Äôt believe the support! Thank you so much to everyone who has reached out directly with offers to help! Outside of donating, we could use all sorts of help including anyone who has a company that could offer in-kind products/gifts/services for our auction at our inauagural gala next year or by participating in our four week online outreach event leading up to giving Tuesday. #thankyou #team #charity #believe ‚Äî‚Äî11/13Thank you for all the shares! It takes a community to save the most vulnerable! #communityhealth #share #charity #help Please consider helping us get to the finish line to get Lucy and every PGAP3 kid the gene therapy treatment that could transform their life. I have always given my best and received a lot. In 25 years I have seen the birth and decline of many technologies and I have experienced firsthand the advent of the internet, eCommerce, social networks, and ultimately the cloud.  My role has been enriched over time because now I also have the moral duty to mentor the new generations of system engineers. How long will my relationship with Microsoft last? As a result, they ensure efficiency, reliability, and ease of integration with other systems by providing a standard approach to designing and building APIs. Here are the most used styles:  üîπSOAP: Mature, comprehensive, XML-based Best for enterprise applications  üîπRESTful: Popular, easy-to-implement, HTTP methods Ideal for web services  üîπGraphQL: Query language, request specific data Reduces network overhead, faster responses  üîπgRPC: Modern, high-performance, Protocol Buffers Suitable for microservices architectures  üîπWebSocket: Real-time, bidirectional, persistent connections Perfect for low-latency data exchange  üîπWebhook: Event-driven, HTTP callbacks, asynchronous Notifies systems when events occur  Over to you: Are there any other famous styles we missed?  ‚Äî Get a Free System Design PDF (158 pages) by subscribing to our weekly newsletter today: https://bit.ly/3FEGliw #systemdesign #coding #interviewtips .', 'Unfortunately, I am part of the 12,000 people laid off from Google today.After 7.5 years, I opened my laptop to find that I no longer have corp access, and a very long off-boarding check list to take care of. reactions: ['A Netflix engineer did 7 onsites interviews for 7 tech companies.  Received 7 offers ranging $325k - $800k a year. He/she shared the resources in Blind that helped her/him to be successful. Here they are:1. LeetcodeAlways ask clarifying questions, they are meant to be vague.Tech Interview Handbook (solve 50 suggested LCs multiple times): https://lnkd.in/dbK9TasPGrokking Coding Interview:https://lnkd.in/d4YzR_3dSolve each question yourself before looking at answers. After struggling with certain topics, found some youtube resources that were really helpful.- Graph problems:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dT4brkwG - Kahn‚Äôs topsort:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dc8VzPx7- Dijkstra‚Äôs shortest path:\xa0https://lnkd.in/djWD4ncp- Kruskal‚Äôs MST:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dUaF7dDr- Union find:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dmZSyGXq- Dynamic programming:\xa0https://lnkd.in/d85BHsQpI would say 1/2 of my coding questions was graph related, and I used topsort, MST, union find during my interviews so its worth knowing them well.Great resource on Binary Search (esp. for harder variants):\xa0https://lnkd.in/dPVikn9eQuite a few LC hards involve binary search as part of its solution, but its non-obvious.At staff level, you are expected to have great communication, come up with one or more high level solutions in reasonable time with space and time complexity, implement mostly correct, and check for errors independently.2. SYSTEM DESIGN Always ask clarifying questions, they are meant to be vague.No. 1 tip: Pay for mock interviews, take extensive notes, study, pay for more interviews. I used igotanoffer.com. Try booking different interviewers, they have different expectations, communication, friendliness.Grokking system design:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dKBtGDDGIt‚Äôs good to complete grokking, but in practice its a little too shallow for staff level.Watch all videos and take notes from this channel:\xa0https://lnkd.in/d32sycXJMost other channels like Exponent are actually not great examples of a good interviewee for staff level.Read papers on Dynamo, BigTable, MapReduce, Cassandra, Raft, Lamport Clocks, etc.A lot of material written by this Medium writer is great:\xa0https://lnkd.in/d_4yxAA7Memorize Jeff Dean‚Äôs latency numbers:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dq42yWsaIf you have time, read DDIA:\xa0https://dataintensive.netI memorized mnemonics for structure of how I execute my interview, as well as for each topic. Like OSI model, caching strategies, load balancing strategies, database types, etc. You need to make up your own in order to ingrain them.link of post from blind website https://lnkd.in/dShYNZDfRemaining tips are in comments:', 'true', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

reactions: ['Yey, awarded for the best speech in ML&DS DUMP section! (read https://lnkd.in/dWMFZEVy is a really magnificent event: large-scale and chamber at the same time that conference is always full of hilarious stands with quests given, top talks by great speakers in program and a lot of fun, including buns for speakers (like excursion to Sysert and preparty in Negodyai bar) and all the stuff done for participants, like merch and really delicious eclers for lunch.It was a great experience to be a speaker on such an event, thanks IT-People for organization!', '–ú—ã —Ç–æ–∂–µ —É–¥–∏–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å, –Ω–æ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–∫. ', 'It‚Äôs the story of how I was laid off from Google before I even started to do my job there.It began nearly a year ago, in April of 2022, when I applied for multiple #SWE and #SRE positions at #Google. I successfully completed five technical interviews during May and June. In July, I entered the Team Matching Phase where I had the opportunity to meet with hiring managers. After attending two meetings, I realized that I wasn\'t interested in joining either team at the moment. Regrettably, I had to wait a considerable amount of time for the next opportunity. Google had announced an international hiring freeze, which essentially halted all interview and job offer processes. The freeze did affect me: I was assigned to a different HR manager who informed me that "Unfortunately we are not in a position to move forward with your application‚ÄùOnly at the end of September I received news that my candidacy could be submitted to the Hiring Committee before completing the team matching phase. Nearly six months after submitting my application, I was thrilled to learn on October 11 that the Hiring Committee had approved me. The next step was to find a team that was willing to bring me on board. Fortunately, a suitable team was found in November.In December, I received and signed an official offer for a SRE position at Google London. I began preparing for my move by taking an English exam and a mandatory tuberculosis test for Russians working in the UK. After the New Year, I applied to the visa application center, which took nearly two months to issue the visa. In March, I quit my previous company, Yandex, to spend the last month preparing for my move to #London.I had planned to fly out on April 10, giving myself a week to acclimate before starting work on April 17. However, on the evening of April 6, I received an unexpected email from Liz West, the head of Google Cloud HR in Europe, asking to connect with me regarding ‚Äúan update on my Google offer‚Äù. During the call, Liz West informed me that my contract with Google had been terminated due to a wave of layoffs that began in the United States and now reached Europe and Britain. ‚ÄúUnfortunately‚Äù, my position had come under reduction, so I no longer had the job I had been working towards for the past year. Nothing personal, just business.Thus, the contract with me has been terminated 10 days before it was supposed to take effect.As for what to do next, I am not entirely sure yet. I held a "garage sale" and sold most of my belongings. The remaining items were either discarded, recycled, or packed into two suitcases that I had planned to take with me. Moving to a new country is a difficult task that typically requires months of preparation. Changing these plans on the fly is challenging and somewhat painful. So I literally don‚Äôt know. However, I feel that I should say something optimistic at the end. Everything will be good üôÇ #layoff', 'Liza and I had a great time participating in Data Dojo as speakers!', '–ü–æ—á–µ–º—É-—Ç–æ –¥—É—à–Ω–∏–ª—ã –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏—Å—å —Å–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–º —Ä–æ–ª–∏–∫–µ.–ù–æ –æ–Ω –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω –∏–º üòÑ ', '–ü–æ–∫–∞ –∏–∑—É—á–∞–ª –Ω–æ—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—é BPMN 2.0, –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–π –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –í–ù–ñ –≤ –¢—É—Ä—Ü–∏–∏, –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∫–æ–º—É –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è ) #bpmn ', "One month ago our team took a prize for solving VTB's MORE.Tech data track challenge. Research and create an in-depth report with a step-by-step guide that will help readers understand how to [insert outcome]."________5. Learn any new skillPrompt:"I want to learn [insert skill]. Rewrite and simplify complex texts"Rewrite the text below in simple and easy to understand words. Learn faster with insight-packed summariesPrompt:"Summarize the text below in no more than 500 words. posts: ['ChatGPT has 100,000,000+ users.But almost everyone\'s STUCK in beginner mode.10 advanced prompts to level up your productivity:1. Improve your decision-makingPrompt:"I am trying to decide if I should [insert decision]. Give me a list of pros and cons that will help me decide why I should or shouldn\'t make this decision."________2. Learn from the bestPrompt:"Analyze the top performers in [insert your field of work]. Give me a list of the most important lessons I can learn from these top performers to boost my productivity."\xa0________3. Create a personalized tutor to accelerate your learningPrompt:"I am currently learning about [insert topic]. Ask me a series of questions that will test my knowledge. Identify knowledge gaps in my answers and give me better answers to fill those gaps."________4. Turn ChatGPT into your internSample prompt:"I am creating a report about [insert topic]. Research and create an in-depth report with a step-by-step guide that will help readers understand how to [insert outcome]."________5. Learn any new skillPrompt:"I want to learn [insert skill]. Generate a 30 day plan that will help a beginner like me learn the skill from scratch."________6. Create any form of text or contentSample prompt:"Topic: How to write persuasivelyAudience: Business executivesFormat: SpeechTone: Educational and inspiringGoal: Inspire the audience to write effectivelyAdditional instructions: The speech should be under 15 minutes"________7. Learn faster than ever with the 80/20 techniquePrompt:"I want to learn about [insert topic]. Identify and share the most important 20% of learnings from this topic that will help me understand 80% of it."________8. Rewrite and simplify complex texts"Rewrite the text below in simple and easy to understand words. Simple and easy enough for anyone who doesn\'t know the subject to understand what I\'m trying to say."[insert text]________9. Learn faster with insight-packed summariesPrompt:"Summarize the text below in no more than 500 words. Create a list of bullet points of the most important learnings, along with brief summaries explaining each point."[insert text]________10. Get ChatGPT to write prompts for youPrompt:"I am a [insert your profession]. Generate a list of the most powerful prompts that will help someone in my profession get more done and save time."________If you liked this, join Superhuman ‚Äï my newsletter with 200k+ readers that teaches you how to leverage AI to boost your productivity:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dVQkm5r2', 'I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Middle Python developer !', '–ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—é —Å–≤–æ—é –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç—É—Ä—É –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—é Python Developer, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–∂—É—Å—å –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—é —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∫—É –∏ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å.–ï—Å–ª–∏ –Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç—ã–∫–∞–π—Ç–µ –ª–∞–π–∫–∏ —á—Ç–æ–±—ã HR –∏–∑ –í–∞—à–µ–≥–æ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤ —É–≤–∏–¥–µ–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –ø–æ—Å—Ç.–ü–æ—Ä—Ç—Ñ–æ–ª–∏–æ: https://oleg.press –†–µ–∑—é–º–µ:https://lnkd.in/eKMURVVm#python #engineer #django #developer #lookingforjob #hr #pythondeveloper ', None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

name: Anastasiia Miagkikh
reactions: ['Houdini ocean#oceanstorm #houdini', 'My new employee asked me one day for time off. I immediately approved it. She was shocked and asked, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you want to know the reason why?‚Äù My reply was, "I don\'t need to know the details. I hired you to get the job done and I trust you to get it done.‚Äù You choose how to get your work done. Come to the office fine. 9 to 5? Fine. Work from home. Fine. Leave early. Fine. Work from the garage while they fix your car? Fine.We are all human. I don\'t need to know you will be late because of a doctor\'s appointment, or you are leaving early to attend a personal matter.It\'s sad how we have infantilized the workplace so much, that employees feel the need to apologize for having personal lives. I am not a clock watcher. I trust you to get your job done. Keep clients happy. I am happy.The future lies in flexible work patterns. Agree?#Leadership #Management #HumanResources #BrigetteHyacinth', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, nan]

Yandex.Station Mini, our first compact smart speaker, is an affordable and convenient way to bring Russia‚Äôs leading intelligent assistant to any room. Users can ask Alice to do any number of tasks with Yandex.Station Mini, from controlling smart home devices and playing music to setting reminders and telling a bedtime story. posts: ['Thanks, Espressif Systems for your trust. Now we are a team, and I will not fail üí™ Ready for new challenges!#newteammember #espressif #newjob', 'I did it! I passed the exam on B2 English level and got the certificate.Thanks, Englex!#B2 #certificate #English #exam #education #school', 'Hello, Connections. Could you help me and find any mistakes, shortcomings, and give me some advice about my resume? Thanks a lot!#resumereview #resume #review #help #career #jobsearch #recruiting', 'One more certificate, connected with Python and Django! üí™', 'Hello, my dear LinkedIn network!Now I need to ask you for some help! My dream is to work in a European —Åountry as a programmer. And I need your help. Maybe you know people/projects/companies in Europe, that have some job opportunities for me. Could you get them my contacts? I am a Middle Python + GIS programmer from Moscow, Russia. I started to learn Python 7 years ago, and now I have a lot of local and job projects. At my current job, I use Python + PyQt + PostgreSQL to automatize processes and tasks. I worked on 7 projects for 2 years and get a lot of experience. It brought the company +274000$ for 2 years. Also, I have one local project with Python (Django) + React. Also, I have a Bauman Moscow State Technical University diploma in Information Security and have a patient for the program with Python. More information about me and my experience you can find in my LinkedIn account.I really believe in LinkedIn network power and magic. So I hope that you, my friends, help me. Thanks a lot!#python #job #experience #jobs #work #opentowork #middle # #europe #postgresql #help', 'I did the first steps in Django. I knew HTML + CSS + SQL, so It was quite easy. Look for the next course in that specialization.#django #html #css #python #sql #programming #coursera #certificate', "I started programming when I was 7 years old.My grandma worked in a company that tried to create a program that will vocalize where you click on the screen or what you type on a keyboard. It program calls 'Speaking mouse 5.0'. When I was young, she started to teach me HTML and CSS technology. I think you understand that now that knowledge is very outdated.But I love programming. It looks as you create a book or a painting. For me, it was like art. After HTML and CSS I stopped working with programming, but when I was 13, I wanted to create a mod on the GTA SAMP game. It is a mod for multiplayer gaming where people tried to play roles. And I started to try to create that mod. I spent near 2 years, wrote 10000+ lines of code on PAWN language (simplified C#), but it was great time. I think, my way started there when I wrote my first big code with functions, logic, and... And it works! That's was great!#programming #firstcode #coding #gaming #remembering", "Why do I love the Chezh Republic?In 2019 I was in the Czech Republic and visited three cities: Prague, Czech Krumlov, and Karlovy Vary. In 2019 for me there were just interesting cities, another place which looks pretty nice, that's all. I saw beautiful places, but I didn't love that country. For me, it was just one another country.But now, when I am thinking about my traveling, I understand, that the Czech Republic is one of the best cities I have ever been to. It's a contrasting city with beautiful history and breathtaking architecture. Now I really want to live in that country, want to walk along the small streets of cities, want to be there. I tried to find a job with relocation, and if somebody asked me about relocation city, I would answer that the Czech Republic one of the most perspective place for me.#travel #job #relocation #tourism #czech #czechrepublic #adventure #prague", 'Today I got a diploma of my university (Bauman Moscow State Technical University). Now I am not a student! #university #higheducation #NotAStuden #opentowork', 'Hi everyone - I am looking for a new role and would appreciate your support. Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork']

We are literally trashing our planet.Gregg Segal photographed his friends, neighbors, and strangers from California, lying in their own trash, made in one week. Even though trash is a global issue, there are vast differences:The average American produces 2.2 kg of trash/day.Average Dutch = 1.7 kg Average Ind = 0.57 kgAverage Chinese = 0.43 kg Globally 2 billion tonnes of municipal solid waste were produced in 2018, of which: 51% of the waste was dumped or uncontrollably disposed of.24.5% was landfilled.13.5% was recycled. 5.5% was composted.5.5% was incinerated In other words: only 19% of those 2 billion tons got back into the loop (composting & recycling).The rest is lost forever, with consequences for our health, planet, and the economy. To stop this, we need to go circular. Minimise waste, limit consumption & close the loop. In this edition, you‚Äôll get a deep walkthrough of JavaScript design patterns interpreted using modern JavaScript language primitives (modules, async/await, classes, WeakMap etc) and a look into React design and rendering patterns. I have wanted to ship a rewrite of this book for a long time and want to thank O‚ÄôReilly for giving me the chance to do this.\xa0It's been ten years since the first edition. To check it out:O‚ÄôReilly platform:\xa0https://lnkd.in/gcuVFXTy\xa0 Amazon physical book pre-order: https://lnkd.in/gVQffeGQ EBooks: https://lnkd.in/gEhxkFvXIn addition to the physical book, I‚Äôve also been working on a supplementary example site with over 100+ runnable demos, mini-quizzes and more patterns for those wanting to go beyond the book. For folks who were fans of our work on patterns.dev, this book covers content that‚Äôs even more broadly applicable using vanilla JavaScript but also offers extended perspectives on how to think about design patterns, rendering, namespacing, file structure and more topics. reactions: ['It doesn‚Äôt matter where you‚Äôre from until you are from Russia. Does it sound fair? For me absolutely not. Scholarships that eliminate Russian citizens from participation do not only discriminate people based on their nationality but also contribute to the Russian government\xa0\xa0propaganda. In this particular case, I‚Äôm speaking about Mastermind scholarship in Belgium, SISGP in Sweden and Chevening in the UK that are closed for applications for Russian citizens as a method of punishment. 1. That is SO unfair toward those who do not support the Russian regime and do not want to receive the pro-government education. You know who is rich enough in Russia to pay 10 000‚Ç¨ per year for masters degree in Europe? Those who are in power now. Their children have money and possibilities. They don‚Äôt need scholarships. Ordinary people from middle class families are not able to pay this amount of money for their education. Scholarships are the only way for them to get a quality education abroad. And yeah, they need it, because the education abroad broadens your horizons, it makes you open-minded because you meet people from other cultures, you see that democracy is not a myth and it is possible to SPEAK UP and NOT get in jail for that. Education changes you in a good way, and it is exactly what we can call a soft power.  2. The more Europe is closed for Russians, the more they believe in ‚Äúthe whole world hates us‚Äù propaganda. When you cut the opportunity to participate in application process, you prove that no one wants Russians, that Europeans hate us (what is, according to my personal experience, is not true at all). This gives the pro-government Russian mass media the material to show that our president is right and ‚ÄúThe Collective West‚Äù is against us. As a consequence, people start believing it and they support the regime more. Do you think it will resolve the conflict in a long term? I do not think so. The whole thing that is happening to all Russian students, who do not support the war, makes me angry and sad at the same time. I‚Äôve been there, I know how it feels when the only chance to see the different point of view is education abroad. And you would never be able to afford it while living in Russia. I‚Äôm very thankful to my Master Mitra (Transnational Migrations) program for everything it gives us, I‚Äôm living my BEST experience in my life, and I see how it makes me more empowered. Education is a soft power and it makes us united. It makes as humans. Do not take a chance from Russian students to become more empowered and change the political situation.P.S. And yes, I‚Äôm totally for giving Ukrainians more funding and helping them out, I know it is much more difficult for them now and I do my best to help.', '–ß—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç—å!–õ–∞–±–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è –ö–∞—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ - –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è ‚Ññ1 –≤ —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–µ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π!', 'We are always happy to celebrate birthdays at CyberHULL!‚†ÄHappy Birthday, Hovhannes!‚†Ä#cyberhull #cyberhullteam #cyberhullarmenia #jobinarmenia', '–° —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞—é, —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏\xa0‚Äì Recruitment Specialist –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ Kaspersky!', "Welcome to the Wrap-Up ‚Äì your summary of the day's top news and talking points, curated by LinkedIn News Europe. ', 'Is now the time to find a job that pays more?\xa0Eurozone inflation is soaring ‚Äî hitting 9.1% last month ‚Äî and for most workers, pay is not keeping up. According to the World Economic Forum, wages have been in the doldrums ever since the global financial crisis of 2007-08. Although they have increased on the back of low inflation since 2012, real wages have only returned to 2008 levels very recently.\xa0Now, the cost of living crisis triggered by the pandemic and the war in Ukraine is having a huge impact on households, with many workers likely wondering what they can do to make themselves feel more financially secure.\xa0Finding a new job is often seen as the quickest route to better pay and since the post-pandemic recovery began in 2021 millions of American workers have quit their jobs in the Great Resignation, something that was mirrored on a smaller scale across Europe.\xa0Economic activity has rebounded this year and low unemployment numbers across Europe point to a strong jobs market, despite inflationary pressure.\xa0But what impact might the continuing war in Ukraine, a looming winter energy crisis and warnings of an imminent global recession have on the labour market in the coming months? We‚Äôre interested in speaking to recruiters: Have you noticed more people seeking job opportunities with higher pay? Or are more workers choosing to stay put, due to economic uncertainty? Tell us in the comments below.‚úçÔ∏è:\xa0Jennifer RyanPhoto source: Getty ImagesSources: https://lnkd.in/exwbnKREhttps://lnkd.in/ewHDeuMDhttps://lnkd.in/eaa6SPY2 #recruiters', "Contribution isn't always loud.", 'This weekend our guys had another tour with our guide. They visited mount Aragats, a 10th-century fortress Anberd, and Stone Lake.#cyberhullarmenia #armeniatrips #triptoarmenia', '10 pieces of career advice I would give to my younger self ü§ì1. Choose a good boss- The size of the company you work for doesn‚Äôt really matter. Who you work with matter the most. Choose a good boss who will help you unleash your potential. 2. You are worthy If you ever make redundant in a job, don‚Äôt ever think you are redundant. Its an awful experience (I tried it), but It‚Äôs really not about you. Move on. 3. Build your network online and offline- Your next employer can be someone you met at a random networking event a few years ago. 4. Join a Toastmasters (public speaking) club as early as possible- It‚Äôs the best way to build your confidence. 5. Do everything- however how trivial it might seem to be - e.g. making a cup of tea for your client or colleague - it is an art! All experiences teach you something. 6. Be a nice person- Don‚Äôt gossip. Help your colleagues. 7. You don‚Äôt need a 10-year career plan- You just need to know what you are truly passionate about and go for it. 8. Take holidays regularly- Slow down to go fast. Rest is a necessity. 9. Ask for a mentor in your job- Even an unofficial one. You can get to your next level faster. 10. Keep upgrading your skills- Even for the same job, the skills required may change in 3 years, as the world keeps evolving. Which piece of advice resonates with you? What would you add to the list? Wishing you all a beautiful career journey ahead, Sally Maier-Yip ‚ú® #career #careeradvice #ilovemyjob ‚ù§Ô∏è #professionaldevelopment #SallyPositive', '–í–æ—Ç —á—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å, –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–∞—è, –∞ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞ —á—Ç–æ —É –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –Ø —Å–ø–∞—Å –µ–µ, —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –æ–Ω–∞ –æ–±–µ—Ä–µ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –∏ –∂–∞–ª–µ–µ—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è)–Ø —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é —Å—Ç–æ—è –∏–±–æ —Å–ø–∏–Ω–∞, —Å–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è. –ê —ç—Ç–æ —á—É–¥–æ —É–ª—è–≥–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Ç–∞–ø–æ–∫ –∏ —É—Ä—á–∏—Ç. –¢–∞–∫ –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ–º –≤–µ—Å—å –¥–µ–Ω—å))', '–í–æ—Ç —á—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å, –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–∞—è, –∞ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞ —á—Ç–æ —É –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –Ø —Å–ø–∞—Å –µ–µ, —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –æ–Ω–∞ –æ–±–µ—Ä–µ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –∏ –∂–∞–ª–µ–µ—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è)–Ø —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é —Å—Ç–æ—è –∏–±–æ —Å–ø–∏–Ω–∞, —Å–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è. –ê —ç—Ç–æ —á—É–¥–æ —É–ª—è–≥–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Ç–∞–ø–æ–∫ –∏ —É—Ä—á–∏—Ç. –¢–∞–∫ –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ–º –≤–µ—Å—å –¥–µ–Ω—å))', 'Adobe released a new 2.4.4 version of\xa0#Magento!‚†ÄHere are major highlights of update:‚†Äüîπ HTTPS is enabled by default for the Magento 2 storefront for enhanced security.üîπ Magento 2.4.4 now supports Elasticsearch 7.16 and OpenSearch 1.2.üîπ Support for the latest version of PHP 8.1.üîπ PWA Studio v.12.3.0 is now supported by the latest Adobe Commerce 2.4.4.üîπ Adobe has removed all the Vendor-bundled extensions from the latest release of Magento except Braintree.üîπ Page builder in Magento 2.4.4 now supports adding alt texts for images.üîπ Plenty of GraphQL enhancements and performance improvements.üîπ Fixed hundreds of known issues in the latest version for better performance.‚†ÄWe are getting ready to upgrade our clients‚Äô stores!‚†Ä#cyberhullarmenia\xa0#magentodevelopers\xa0#phpjob\xa0#jsjob #workinarmenia\xa0#workinyerevan', "Don't do it. For the next sprint PM will assign —Ö2 tasks to you#work #job #sprint #task #development #develop #pm #project #zoom #meeting #dev #it #humor #ithumor", "Every now and then we go on trips exploring Armenia. We've been to many beautiful places already! #cyberhullarmenia\xa0#armeniatrips\xa0#triptoarmenia", 'We are hiring in our Armenian office, Yerevan!‚†ÄWe‚Äôre looking for JavaScript developers:‚†ÄJob responsibilities:üîπ Website development for American and European companies;üîπ Building JavaScript-based web applications using modern frameworks and libraries;üîπ Markup and styling of web-based applications elements;üîπ Working in a large team, participation in daily meetings, building high quality products.‚†ÄRequirements:üîπ Be highly proficient with JavaScript and its features (knowledge of Vue.js, React, Node.js will be a plus);Good knowledge of HTML5, CSS2+3;üîπ Good understanding of responsive design implementation;üîπ Preferably, knowledge of ECMAScript 6;üîπ It will be an advantage if you have a portfolio of the above-mentioned skills.‚†ÄHighly appreciated:üîπ Experience in development of Progressive Web Applicationsüîπ Experience in Magento 2, Bigcommerce, Adobe Experience Manager, Demandware, Hybrisüîπ Intermediate level of English is a must.‚†ÄWe offer:üîπ Work in the office or hybrid work schedule, flexible working hours: 11 am - 8 pm; 12 pm - 9 pm; 1 pm - 10 pm (Armenia time);üîπ Office location ‚Äì Yerevan city, Grigor Lusavorich str., 9;üîπ We offer relocation to Armenia. The company bears the cost of airline tickets, helps with finding accommodation and provides information support;üîπ Training programs, English classes, professional literature, dev meetups;üîπ Offline and online team building activities (pizza parties, corporate events), monthly and annual awards (Most Helpful Peer, Star of the Month, Star of the Year);üîπ Work on ground-breaking projects that suit you best in a dedicated team of professionals;üîπ Career development (all of our solution architects and project managers started their work in our company as developers);üîπ Employment Under the Labour Code;üîπ Overtime work strictly voluntary; always paid.‚†ÄPlease send us your CV at am-hr@cyberhull.com.‚†ÄCome join our team!‚†Ä#cyberhullarmenia #jobinarmenia #jobinyerevan #magento2development #hiringinarmenia', "I was graduated from Oil and Gas University and absolutely understand processes that are included in upstream, midstream and downstream. So, frequently I'm thinking about how to make production of oil and gas more clear and environmentally friendly. I've just find an excellent article that surprised me a lot.That was about Integrating Renewable Energy Technologies in Oil and Gas Operations. I would like to share some main points from it just to be clear what does integrating means.1. Upstream: Renewable Integration in Oil and Gas ProductionHere, I can underline 3 ways: - electrification of drilling and recovery means that electric generations can be implemented instead of natural gas ones- offshore wind power can be used to power water injection pumps- solar thermal EOR substitutes natural gas with concentrated solar power (CSP) as the energy source for producing steam.2. Midstream: Renewable Integration in Oil and Gas Transportation- replace gas engines in compressors with electric motors that could increase renewable integration and reduce noise, fuel use, and emissions- start using turboexpanders. The potential energy created from raising pipeline pressure is lost when the pressure is stepped down at distribution hubs. A turboexpander can capture this potential energy to generate electricity3. Downstream:Renewable Integration in Oil Refining- concentrated solar energy can complement or replace conventional fuel as the heating source in several production processes at the refinery.- renewable energy such as solar or can be used to run machinery, such as compressors, pumps, circulators, and controllers, and also can reduce operation costs and carbon emissions.In conclusion, in the nearest future people should be attantive in the issue of the climate change and environment. #oilandgas #drilling #refinery #naturalgas #future", None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, nan]

And I regret to use it as such, and I am scared to do so. But I also know that fear is temporary, and regret is forever.Today was the longest and the hardest day in my life. And it will be the longest night. Today in the small city in Ukraine not far from the Russian border, a kindergarten was shelled with uragan (hurricane) weapon. 3 people died, and 8 injured (including one dead kid and one kid fighting for his life in the hospital now). These kids were not in the kindergarten, but they searched for a shelter that was located there and could not manage to hide in time.In one of universities, students and lectors are hiding in shelters on campus, because the territory around the university is heavily shelled with missiles. Streets of my beloved, ancient, beautiful Kyiv are empty. Now, when I write these words, the air Defence alarm is on and people are hiding in bomb-shelters. There are long lines of men, who tried to receive any weapon and be able to help the army and defend the city by themselves. Because the occupation force is overwhelming and army is not enough.I mentioned only these three cases, not because there is nothing else happening today in Ukraine. A lot of people lost their homes and lives today. But this kindergarten was shelled in my hometown Okhtyrka, while my parents were hiding in the basement trying to survive. Okhtyrka is an excellent representation of a ‚ÄúRussian-speaking community in the Eastern Ukraine‚Äù, and we never ever experienced any kind of genocide. It is just insane to hear that.This university is my Alma-mater, where I did my masters degree, and I personally know those lectors who are writing from the bomb shelter. And this is my dearest friend, who took a weapon today to protect Kyiv. He is a professor with PhD, and works in international trade relations. And he has never held a weapon in his hands. But today, he is a soldier. Those, who know me, will understand that this is not the fake news. I will ask only for one thing.Kyiv is just 2 hours by plane from Germany. The crimes which happened today in Ukraine are war crimes beyond any ‚Äúred lines‚Äù. Nothing else can be crossed. There is no way back and nothing that can stop him now. There are no such things as country borders or civilians anymore, neither such concept as international law.These few days will be crucial. Please stand with Ukrainians on your streets. Please stand for Ukraine. They deserve it. These people are so brave and amazing, and their courage is what holds the madness and war out of Europe. With K3s and K8s APIs, Light Edge PC-sized devices can be easily orchestrated, making AKS EE a perfect solution for a ubiquitous orchestration plane.As someone who was part of the private preview of Azure IoT Edge in 2014, I can attest it was excellent at its time and that a lot has changed in the past decade. Today AKS EE is fit for the next decade. If you're using Azure IoT Edge, now is the time to switch to AKS EE. Try it out and let me know what you think in the comments below!#AKSEE #AKSEdgeEssentials #Kubernetes #OTSystems #itotconvergence #ITOT #mitkox ", "I think Microsoft is going into the right direction with the approach of supporting Kubernetes from the Cloud to the Edge especially for building hybrid cloud IIoT platforms. I'm just not sure how many people will want to run Kubernetes on top of a Linux VM on top of Windows IoT (especially on smaller edge devices in a control cabinet). My feeling is that many that have reached this level of maturity will want to run Kubernetes just on Linux (with running on something like VMWare optionally). reactions: ["If you're an IT professional, navigating the Linux file system is a skill that can take you far. It's meticulously organized - like a well-structured library. Each directory has a unique, specific purpose. Let's demystify the key directories: üöÄ/: The root directory where it all begins. Every other directory is a subdirectory of this one./ùóØùó∂ùóª: Contains fundamental binary files, necessary for minimal system functioning./ùòÄùóØùó∂ùóª: Similar to /bin, but contains binaries essential for system bootup and repair./ùó≤ùòÅùó∞: Holds system-wide configuration files. It's the go-to place for system administrators./ùóµùóºùó∫ùó≤: A personal space for users. Think of it as your work desk, containing your documents, downloads, and more./ùòÉùóÆùóø: Stores variable data files such as logs, emails, print queues, and most notably databases./ùòÇùòÄùóø: Holds user-related programs, libraries, and files./ùóπùó∂ùóØ: Contains shared library files supporting the binaries in /bin and /sbin./ùóºùóΩùòÅ: Optional or add-on software packages are located here./ùòÅùó∫ùóΩ: A place for temporary files used by the system, cleared upon reboot./ùóØùóºùóºùòÅ: All the files necessary for booting the system are here./ùó±ùó≤ùòÉ: Contains device files for all hardware devices on the system./ùóΩùóøùóºùó∞: An interesting directory that doesn't contain files but system and process information./ùóøùóºùóºùòÅ: This is the home directory for the root user, not to be confused with the root (/) directory at the top of the filesystem./ùóøùòÇùóª: This directory hosts temporary files (like /tmp) but these are specifically related to running processes and are created at an early stage of the boot process./ùòÄùóøùòÉ: This directory contains data for services provided by the system./ùòÄùòÜùòÄ: Similar to /proc, this is a virtual filesystem providing a unified interface through which the kernel provides information about devices, drivers, and some kernel features./ùó∫ùóªùòÅ: This is a generic mount point under which you mount filesystems or devices./ùó∫ùó≤ùó±ùó∂ùóÆ: This directory is generally used by the system as a mount point for removable media like CDs, digital cameras, or other media devices.ùó™ùóµùòÜ
