See how it works.', "During my first year of working at Google, I met a mentor who told me apply & interview for roles I saw potential in EVERY year, even if I loved my job. As an Asian American, I felt weird to continually seek for more in a time of comfort. I was told to be grateful for what I have, work hard and don't make too much change. But my mentor changed my mentality because no one will care for your career more than you do. He told me the best time to find a job when you're NOT looking for a job for 3 reasons:- You can be as picky as you want without the pressure of NEEDING to find a job- You continue to train your interviewing skills - Most importantly, you validate you are being paid & treated fairlyIn the past 2 years, I've interviewed with over 20 opportunities I saw potential career paths in including Spotify, DoorDash & Facebook - not because I was desperate to leave.But to make sure Google valued me more than everyone else.#JustJerry #Wonsulting", 'Very exciting that Virgin Galactic has revealed its initial vehicle design for high speed travel: http://ow.ly/dOVJ50AP7Fp', "Why did Acumatica put the selling and implementing of our cloud ERP software into the hands of Certified Value Added Resellers? reactions: ["Crocus. Ozon forum. 8k people in the hall and 80k on the broadcast. I'm scared, but I'm cool. The biggest product demo in my life.Thanks to the team for the results, to the organizers for the preparation and to my wife for the support. This wouldn't have happened without you", "Hey, does anybody here use Slack or another messenger and, within the last month, been in a situation like these:ü¶π You're a PM, and your project got delayed because you've missed an important update in Slack discussions or threads.üôã\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏è You are a Manager, and you have to scan and read your Slack for 2-3 hours daily to ensure you will get everything essential.‚≠êÔ∏è You are part of a large team, and for the sake of time, you skip some channels or threads altogether, and, at some point, you miss an important update.Or any other problems related to information overload or fatigue due to a large volume of messages. So that leads to misalignment, breached deadlines, and meaningless projects.\xa0 If you experience anything like this, please feel free to comment. I have an idea of how to address that, and perhaps I can help :) #team #aligment #communication ", 'If you often feel desperate, it might mean your resilience and "embracing the unknown" skills are remarkable or about to become great.There are a ton of articles and blog posts about how it is essential to be resilient. Many of them draw an excellent high-level picture and break down what resilience is into smaller buckets. But I\'ve not seen many that explained the things you go through exactly each time you hit the wall. At the same time, I\'ve noticed that on the path of empowering resilience, many of my peers ‚Äî including myself ‚Äî almost always went through one crucial step, yet barely talked about and brought up to the public or themselves. And recognizing this step could help you bounce back faster whenever you fall.I\'m talking about desperation. Let me explain.Let\'s say you want to get a promotion. You tried asking for a raise directly, are doing extra hours and taking extra responsibilities, and are always there for your peers. But the raise does not happen. And at some point, the perfectly normal questions arise: "What is going on?"So, you can treat it differently.You can deny: "That\'s alright. I\'m right. Let\'s double down on efforts."\xa0You can devalue: "Well, this doesn\'t matter much. Let\'s focus on my hobby instead."\xa0You can cope any other way.OrYou can face it: "Oh, this is really happening. Something is wrong, or I am doing something wrong."This moment is magical because you will most likely feel desperation. This desperation comes from the realization that you thought something was true, but it was wrong. Could you give yourself time to sit tight with this feeling? Something significant will happen afterward.The feeling eventually will dissolve. And once it\'s out, you can embrace the recently unknown reality. By being out of those heavy feelings, you also would be able to be calm and to think clearly.This is precisely what we need.No need to mention how powerful this skill is when learning stacks.Let\'s say you pitch your idea 30 times a week and fail 29 of them. I just wish you could hear me and my pain about what is happening today. In 2020, there were mass protests against Lukashenko in Belarus; it was the biggest and longest protest the Belarusian people had seen. We suffered for our political activism. We were beaten to death by the police, our property was taken from us by the government, we were fired from our jobs, we were expelled from universities, we were given fines of sums that were impossible to pay. We waited for support from other countries, we waited for sanctions from the European Union, from the United States. However, no one paid any attention to us. I do not want to blame other countries, they helped to spread the problem of the Belarusians, they helped us with support, I really appreciate it! But what do we see now? Hundreds of people accuse me of being Belarusian, hundreds of people react aggressively to the fact that I speak Russian. I can't work in international business, I can't easily find new contacts and make friends with people from Europe or America. More than 250 thousand people left Belarus in 2020 for political reasons. In percentage terms, that's the same as if 8.5 million people left the United States. People keep leaving because they don't agree with the government because the government of Belarus destroys our lives. I am Belarusian, right now I live in the Czech Republic and I support Ukraine, and every day I fall asleep with fear in my heart.We hate our government and we showed it in 2020. Andy van den Dobbelsteen, hoogleraar Climate Design & Sustainability, presenteert de Roadmap met praktische voorbeelden uit lokale buurten en toont de verschillende scenario's in het realiseren van ambitieuze klimaatdoelstellingen.
